ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] New to online Gaming
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: quiller64  To:  Sent: Thursday, May 23, 2002 10:46 PM Subject: [EverQuest] New to online Gaming ...
ygData.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "quiller64" <jflip64@...>
To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, May 23, 2002 10:46 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] New to online Gaming


> Hi all,
> Having been a fan of computer RPG's for years I am considering trying
> EQ. Having never played an online rpg before I have a few questions ?
> (Forgive my lack of knowledge and feel free to laugh at my questions)
> 1. Being used to playing solo games I could pretty much play at my
> own pace. How does EQ work? I know you join other online players but
> seeing as I am a casual gamer i only spend 10-15 hours a week gaming
> is this enough for EQ ? I am assuming that play occurs with whoever
> is online at the time and am I not tied into a specific group/times.


Yes you can play as much as you want..........you are noe tied down to
specific groups or times unless you want to be. But watch out it is know as
evercrack for a reason.

>
> 2. Is it easy to find other adventurers to join with?

Yes it is very easy to fine other peeps to play with.

>
> 3. I see different EQ's (Original, Ruins of Kharnak, etc) does it
> matter which one I start with or are the later addons geared for
> higher level characters.

MY recomendation is to get the trilogy it gives you the three old world game
and expansions and also get the luclin expansion, it will save a lot of
headaces later on, all of the expansions are geared for all levels and style
of play, just the new one coming out in october will be gared for the higher
lvls.

>
> 4 Finally system requirements. I have seen the system requirements
> but what is recommended ?. I have a P3 866, 128sdram, 32mb ddr nvidia
> geforce2 gts card, 56k modem is that suffiecient or should I wait
> till I upgrade.

The speed and cpu are fine but I highly recomend upgrading the memory to 512
mb or the highest you motherboard can hold, the graphics card and modem will
work till you upgrade.


>
> Thanks for any feedback
>
>
>
> Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
>
>
> Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
>
>
>
